title: Institutional Gold Paper conceptual expansions (frontend content-only)

requirements.summary: Add clearly separated, conceptual-only “Institutional Expansion / Conceptual Appendix” sections to existing institutional pages without removing or overwriting current content, including MiCA/GDPR-aligned non-operational disclaimers and explicit separation from the AR game.
acceptanceCriteria: Existing institutional pages retain all current headings/sections and their original text (no deletions/overwrites).
New content is added as clearly labeled expansion/refinement sections (e.g., 'Institutional Expansion' / 'Conceptual Appendix') rather than replacing current content.
All new sections include explicit non-operational language (no promises, no operational instructions, no calls to action to invest) and include MiCA/GDPR-aligned disclaimers.
No gameplay/game-reward mechanics are introduced into these institutional expansions.

file_operations.description: Create a reusable presentational wrapper for additive content blocks labeled as “Institutional Expansion” / “Conceptual Appendix”, including a standard non-operational MiCA/GDPR-aligned disclaimer and an explicit “separate from AR game” note.

Append (do not replace) a new “Institutional Expansion / Conceptual Appendix” section that frames added tokenomics explanations as conceptual/non-operational and explicitly separate from the AR game; reuse InstitutionalExpansionSection for consistent labeling and disclaimers.

Append (do not replace) new “Institutional Expansion / Conceptual Appendix” content reinforcing conceptual/non-operational status and explicit separation from the AR game; reuse InstitutionalExpansionSection for consistent labeling and disclaimers.

Append (do not replace) governance-focused “Institutional Expansion / Conceptual Appendix” content with explicit non-operational language and MiCA/GDPR-aligned disclaimers; ensure no references or links to gameplay mechanics; reuse InstitutionalExpansionSection.

Append (do not replace) an “Institutional Expansion / Conceptual Appendix” clarifying that the institutional descriptions are conceptual and non-operational, include MiCA/GDPR-aligned disclaimers, and explicitly note separation from the AR game; reuse InstitutionalExpansionSection.

Append (do not replace) an “Institutional Expansion / Conceptual Appendix” clarification that the described governance/treasury/token mechanics are conceptual-only in this institutional context, include MiCA/GDPR-aligned non-operational disclaimers, and explicitly state separation from the AR game; reuse InstitutionalExpansionSection.

requirements.summary: Add static, bank-style conceptual explanatory blocks (tables/diagrams in markup) for token distribution, locked vs unlocked balances, illustrative vesting/unlock timelines, and theoretical treasury flow model in appropriate institutional pages.
acceptanceCriteria: Token distribution expansion is descriptive and does not introduce new numeric commitments or operational issuance details beyond what already exists on the site; any added structure is clearly marked conceptual/illustrative.
Locked vs unlocked section clearly states restrictions are conceptual and not currently executed by the system.
Vesting/unlock content is presented as illustrative models (e.g., linear/cliff/multi-stage/regulatory stop-gates) and explicitly states no real schedule is active.
Treasury flows are shown as theoretical inbound/outbound categories and explicitly state they are inactive/non-operational.
Any tables/diagrams added are static, informational UI elements only (no interactive financial tooling).

file_operations.description: Add conceptual, static explanatory blocks under a new additive “Institutional Expansion” section: (1) conceptual token distribution framework table (categories + purpose + illustrative notes), (2) locked vs unlocked balances comparison table with explicit “not executed by the system” language, and (3) illustrative vesting/unlock timeline models presented as static table/diagram-like markup with explicit “no real schedule active” disclaimers.

Add a theoretical treasury flow model as static markup (e.g., table or simple diagram layout for inbound/outbound/inactive buckets) and an illustrative vesting/unlock model table; ensure all additions are explicitly conceptual, inactive, and non-operational.

Add a governance-adjacent, bank-style conceptual block that explains how treasury oversight could be represented (descriptive only) and how locked/unlocked or vesting concepts could be *interpreted* in governance discussions without implying operational execution; present as static tables/diagrams in markup only.

requirements.summary: Improve readability of affected institutional pages using content-only layout refinements while preserving the existing premium black/gold style, without introducing routes, backend calls, or gameplay cross-linking.
acceptanceCriteria: Pages keep the existing black/gold theme and institutional tone; changes are limited to content presentation (headings, spacing, callouts, tables).
No new navigation routes are added and no existing routes are removed.
No new links or sections are added that connect these institutional expansions to game mechanics or gameplay pages.
No backend calls, React Query changes, or authentication/actor usage changes are introduced as part of these content updates.

file_operations.description: Add small, theme-consistent styles for static informational tables/diagrams and disclaimer callouts used by the new conceptual expansion sections (keep black/gold premium look; no functional/interactive styling).

Refine typography/structure (headings, spacing, optional chapter numbering support) to improve readability of appended institutional expansion content while keeping presentation strictly informational and non-operational.

Apply content-only readability refinements for the newly appended conceptual blocks (clear headings, spacing, callout disclaimers, static tables) while keeping existing sections unchanged and avoiding any gameplay references or new navigation.

Apply content-only readability refinements to appended conceptual blocks (clearer subheadings, separators, static tables) while keeping existing sections intact and avoiding any backend/auth/query changes.
Apply content-only readability refinements to appended conceptual blocks (headings, spacing, static tables/diagrams) and ensure no new links/routes or gameplay cross-linking are introduced.
Apply content-only readability refinements for appended conceptual disclaimer content (callouts, spacing) while keeping the existing legal cards and text unchanged.
Apply content-only readability refinements for appended clarifications (callouts, spacing), ensuring no new links beyond existing documentation linkouts and no gameplay cross-linking.
